summary: This FBI 302 form documents an interview conducted on August 10, 2019, with a BOP nurse/medic regarding the medical response to Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on July 23, 2019. The nurse describes arriving at Epstein's cell, finding him unresponsive with a ligature around his neck, and the subsequent unsuccessful resuscitation efforts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on the morning of July 23, 2019. The document details the medical response to his death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) with a ligature around his neck. BOP guards were administering CPR when medical staff arrived. Resuscitation efforts, including AED use and epinephrine, were unsuccessful.

events.title: FBI Interview with BOP Nurse
events.description: An FBI investigator interviewed a BOP nurse/medic regarding the medical response to Jeffrey Epstein's death. The interview took place on the 9th floor outside the 'L' tier at the correctional facility.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 0633 hours on July 23, 2019.
A BOP nurse arrived at the cell at 0635 hours and observed guards administering CPR to Epstein.
The nurse detected no pulse or signs of life and noted a ligature was still around Epstein's neck.
Resuscitation efforts included attempted use of an Automated External Defibrillator (AED) which advised 'no shock', intubation, oxygen, and three rounds of epinephrine.
Epstein was found lying parallel to his bunk bed with his head towards the wall the desk was affixed to.
